document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Molineus (Nematoda: Molineidae) parasite of Procyon lotor (Mammalia: Carnivora) in Mexico with a taxonomic key for the species of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Molineus (Nematoda: Molineidae) parasite of Procyon lotor (Mammalia: Carnivora) in Mexico with a taxonomic key for the species of the genus

heading.emphasis:
Taxonomic key for the species included in
Molineus
distributed worldwide

subSubSection.paragraph:
3 Spicules with distal end of internal process tri-digitated..........................
M. brachyurus Costa & Freitas, 1967 Host
:
Chrysocyon brachyurus
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm

- Spicules with distal end of internal process terminating in point............................
M. cynictis (Leroux, 1933) Host
: Cynictis penicillata ( Carnivora ); Ethiopian Realm

5 Spicules with a conspicuous medially-directed barb anteriorly............................
M. barbatus Chandler, 1942 Host
:
Procyon lotor
( Carnivora ); Nearctic Realm
- Spicules without a conspicuous medially-directed barb anteriorly................................................ 6

6 Spicules complex, with the internal process slender, ending in globular swelling........................
M. lotoris
n. sp .
Host:
Procyon lotor
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm

- Spicules simple, terminating in 2 needlelike processes......................
M. asiaticus Tubangui & Masilugnan, 1937 Host
:
Paradoxurus hermaphroditus
( Carnivora ); Oriental Realm

7 Spicules with 1 straight process and other ending in hook.........
M. elegans (Travassos, 1921) Travassos & Darriba, 1929 Host
:
Saimiri sciureus
( Primates ); Neotropical Realm
- Spicules with both processes with straight distal ends........................................................ 8

8 Bursa not distinctly divided into lobes................................................
M. felineus Cameron, 1923 Host
:
Puma yagouaroundi
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm

- Bursa distinctly divided into lobes.................................................
M. paraensis Travassos, 1937 Host
:
Potos flavus
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm
- Terminal processes of spicules different in length........................................................... 14

10 Length of spicules <0.1...................................
M. inexpectatus Durette-Desset
, Guerrero & Boyer, 2000 Host:
Lachesis muta
( Squamata ); Neotropical Realm

11 Dorsal lobe not differentiated from the lateral lobes......................................
M. europaeus Zunker, 1928 Host
:
Mustela putorius
( Carnivora ); Palearctic Realm
- Dorsal lobe differentiated from the lateral lobes............................................................. 12

12 Length of spicules> 0.17..........................................................
M. torulosus (Molin, 1861) Host
:
Cebus capucinus
( Primates ); Neotropical Realm

- Length of spicules <0.14.............................................................................. 13 13 Point of interno-dorsal process of spicules hammer-shaped...................
M. midas Durette-Desset & Corvione, 1998 Host
:
Saguinus midas
( Primates ); Neotropical Realm

- Terminal processes of spicules ending in point............................................
M. major Cameron, 1936 Host
:
Eira Barbara
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm

15 Dorsal ray shorter than rays 4...................................................
M. planicipitis (Cameron, 1928) Host
:
Prionailurus planiceps
( Carnivora ); Oriental Realm

16 Terminal processes of spicules not fused nor enveloped by a membrane.....................
M. barbaris Cameron, 1936 Host
:
Eira barbara
( Carnivora ); Neotropical Realm
- Terminal processes of spicules fused or enveloped by a membrane.............................................. 17

17 Terminal processes of spicules enveloped by a membrane................

:
Felis catus
( Carnivora ); Ethiopian Realm

:

( Carnivora ); Nearctic Realm

- Rays 9 entire................................................................

:
